lead_paragraph: The American Bar Association plans to tighten a rule that 75 percent of a law school’s students must pass the bar exam within two years of graduation.

headline.print_headline: American Bar Association Wants Stricter Timeline for Law Graduates to Pass Bar
headline.main: A.B.A. to Enforce Stricter Timeline for Law Graduates to Pass the Bar Exam

snippet: The American Bar Association plans to tighten a rule that 75 percent of a law school’s students must pass the bar exam within two years of graduation.
abstract: American Bar Assn says it will tighten rule setting deadline for law school graduates to pass state bar exams; new measure will clarify that 75 percent of students must pass within two years.
